IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AIMED AT CONSERVING THE MARINE ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO CONSERVE THE MARINE ENVIRONMENT, NOW AND FOR GENERATIONS TO COME, THROUGH SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND EDUCATION. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O)THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION (GHF) CONDUCTS SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND HOSTS EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AIMED AT CONSERVING THE MARINE ENVIRONMENT. THE GHF WILL HELP ENSURE THAT FUTURE GENERATIONS CAN ENJOY AND BENEFIT FROM A NATURALLY BALANCED OCEAN ECOSYSTEM.THE GHF ALSO FUNDS INSPIRED SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND INNOVATIVE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS DEVELOPED BY UNIVERSITIES, COLLEGES, INSTITUTES, AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROMISE TO BRING NEW IDEAS AND INITIATIVES TO MARINE CONSERVATION AND THAT ENCOURAGE CONSERVATIONS AND BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICE FOR SUSTAINABLE MARINE ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Desc: SCIENCE AND RESEARCH: THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION (GHF) RESEARCH PROGRAMS ARE DEDICATED TO EXPANDING THE SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE NECESSARY FOR EFFECTIVE CONSERVATION OF FISH POPULATIONS AND MAINTENANCE OF FISH BIODIVERSITY. THE HIGH-QUALITY SCIENTIFIC INFORMATION PROVIDED BY GHF IS CRITICAL TO THE UNIVERSALLY RECOGNIZED URGENT NEED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT EFFECTIVE MEASURES FOR THE CONSERVATION AND ENHANCEMENT OF FISH RESOURCES WORLDWIDE. RESEARCH PROGRAMS INCLUDE: (1) SATELLITE TAGGING SHORTFIN MAKO SHARKS, (2) SATELLITE AND CONVENTIONAL TAGGING DOLPHINFISH IN THE NW ATLANTIC OCEAN, CARIBBEAN SEA, AND EASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC, AND (3) TAGGING AND TRACKING BILLFISH IN THE EASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC OCEAN. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O)1. SATELLITE TAGGING SHORTFIN MAKO SHARKS IN THE NW ATLANTIC OCEAN AND WESTERN CARIBBEAN / GULF OF MEXICO. THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION AND GUY HARVEY RESEARCH INSTITUTE (GHRI) AT NOVA SOUTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY DEPLOYED FIVE SATELLITE TRACKING TAGS (SPOT TAGS) ON SHORTFIN MAKO SHARKS IN THE NW ATLANTIC OCEAN AND WESTERN CARIBBEAN / GULF OF MEXICO AS PART OF A MULTIYEAR STUDY TO UNDERSTAND THE MIGRATION PATTERNS AND FISHING MORTALITY FOR THIS SPECIES. THIS RESEARCH PROJECT PROVIDED THE FIRST FISHERIES-INDEPENDENT FISHING MORTALITY RATE FOR THIS ECONOMICALLY AND ECOLOGICALLY IMPORTANT SPECIES, WHICH WAS 10 TIMES HIGHER THAN PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT. THIS DISCOVERY LED THE INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATION THAT MANAGES MAKO SHARKS TO DOWNGRADE THEIR STATUS TO OVERFISHED WITH OVERFISHING OCCURRING. THIS CHANGE OF STATUS, IN TURN, PROMPTED THE U.S. GOVERNMENT (NOAA) TO INCREASE PROTECTIONS FOR MAKO SHARKS IN FEDERAL WATERS, INCLUDING MANDATING THE RELEASE OF LIVE MAKO SHARKS IN THE COMMERCIAL FISHERY AND AN INCREASED MINIMUM SIZE IN THE RECREATIONAL FISHER.2. SATELLITE AND CONVENTIONAL TAGGING DOLPHINFISH IN THE NW ATLANTIC OCEAN, CARIBBEAN SEA, AND EASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC. THE FOUNDATION PARTNERED WITH THE DOLPHINFISH RESEARCH PROGRAM TO DEPLOY POP-UP SATELLITE TRACKING TAGS (PSA TAGS) AND GEOLOCATING TAGS ON ATLANTIC AND PACIFIC DOLPHINFISH AND TO ENGAGE RECREATIONAL ANGLERS IN A TAG AND RECAPTURE CITIZEN SCIENCE STUDY. THIS HIGHLY REPRODUCTIVE FISH HAS LONG BEEN THOUGHT TO BE IMMUNE TO OVERFISHING BUT ANECDOTAL EVIDENCE IS SHOWING A DECLINE IN THE NUMBERS AND SIZE OF DOLPHINFISH AROUND THE WORLD AND SPECIFICALLY IN THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. THE SATELLITE TAGGING STUDY IS HELPING RESEARCHERS BETTER UNDERSTAND THE SEASON MIGRATIONS OF THESE FISH WHILE THE TAG AND RECAPTURE STUDY IS PROVIDING INVALUABLE DATA BOUT THE INCREDIBLY FAST GROWTH RATE OF THESE FISH AND HOW OFTEN THEY ARE CAUGHT. THESE DATA ARE FUNDAMENTAL TO CONSERVING THIS COMMERCIALLY AND RECREATIONALLY IMPORTANT SPECIES.3. TAGGING AND TRACKING BILLFISH IN THE EASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC OCEAN. THE FOUNDATION PARTNERED WITH NOVA SOUTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY AND TROPIC STAR LODGE IN PANAMA ON A COMPREHENSIVE STUDY OF THE BILLFISH AND OTHER LARGE VERTEBRATES THAT INHABIT THE EASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC OCEAN. THIS IS THE FOURTH YEAR OF A FIVE-YEAR STUDY TO DEPLOY SATELLITE POP-UP TAGS AND ACCELEROMETER TAGS ON BLUE MARLIN, BLACK MARLIN, AND SAILFISH TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THEIR MIGRATION PATTERNS AND HOW THESE SPECIES RECOVER FROM THE CATCH AND RELEASE PROCESS. THERE IS A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF COMMERCIAL FISHING IN THIS REGION SO FISHERIES MANAGERS NEED TO KNOW WHERE THESE BILLFISH ARE TRAVELLING. ADDITIONALLY, THE RECREATIONAL FISHERY IS VERY VALUABLE TO THE REGION SO IT IS IMPORTANT TO UNDERSTAND THE EFFECTS THAT THE CATCH AND RELEASE PROCESS HAS ON THESE ANIMALS. BAILED REMOTE UNDERWATER VIDEO CAMERAS ARE ALSO BEING DEPLOYED AT A RANGE OF DISTANCES AND DEPTHS TO GET A BETTER OVERALL VIEW OF THE LARGE ANIMALS THAT LIVE IN OR MOVE THROUGH THIS REGION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION: THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION (GHF) OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS TO UNIVERSITY STUDENTS STUDYING MARINE SCIENCE AND WORKING TO BECOME FUTURE LEADERS OF OCEAN CONSERVATION. GHF, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE GUY HARVEY ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM, OFFER FOUR (4) 4-YEAR FLORIDA UNIVERSITY PLAN SCHOLARSHIPS TO GRADUATING HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS WHO PLAN TO ATTEND NOVA SOUTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY. IN ADDITION, SCHOLARSHIPS ARE FUNDED BY THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION AND ADMINISTERED BY THE FLORIDA SEA GRANT COLLEGE PROGRAM. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O)FLORIDA SEA GRANT COLLEGE PROGRAM: THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE FUNDED BY THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION AND ADMINISTERED BY THE FLORIDA SEA GRANT COLLEGE PROGRAM. THE GUY HARVEY SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS SUPPORT UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WHO ARE ENROLLED FULL TIME AT FLORIDA INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION WHO ARE CONDUCTING RESEARCH RELATED TO THE BIOLOGY, ECOLOGY, HABITAT, OR MANAGEMENT OF FISH IN FLORIDA'S MARINE ENVIRONMENT. UP TO EIGHT SCHOLARSHIPS WILL BE GIVEN THIS YEAR TO OUTSTANDING FLORIDA STUDENTS. THE SCHOLARS WILL RECEIVE A CERTIFICATE DESIGNED AND SIGNED BY GUY HARVEY AND $5,000 TO SUPPORT THEIR ACADEMIC PROGRAM. THE FOUNDATION AWARDED 8 SCHOLARSHIPS OF $5,000 EACH DURING 2021.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, REASON FOR PUBLIC CHARITY STATUS:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: SCHEDULE A, PART I, REASON FOR PUBLIC CHARITY STATUS, HAS BEEN UPDATED WITH THE 2021 FILING TO LINE 7, AN ORGANIZATION THAT NORMALLY RECEIVES A SUBSTANTIAL PART OF ITS SUPPORT FROM A GOVERNMENT UNIT OR FROM THE GENERAL PUBLIC DESCRIBED IN SECTION 170(B)(1)(A)(VI), IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOUNDATION'S IRS DETERMINATION LETTER. AS A RESULT OF THIS CHANGE, THE FOUNDATION IS COMPLETING PART II (INSTEAD OF PART III AS WAS COMPLETED IN THE PRIOR YEAR). DURING PREPARATION OF PART II, INCOME WAS ANALYZED AND RECATEGORIZED AS APPROPRIATE TO PROPERLY STATE INCOME FOR THE FIVE-YEAR REPORTING PERIOD. GOVERNMENT FUNDING PREVIOUSLY REPORTED AS PROGRAM SERVICE INCOME HAS BEEN RECATEGORIZED TO GRANT INCOME IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATE FUNDING PROGRAM GUIDELINES. INVESTMENT INCOME HAS BEEN SEGREGATED OR ADDED AS APPROPRIATE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION SUPPORTS THE CENTER FOR SPORTFISHING POLICY. THE CENTER FOR SPORTFISHING POLICY IS THE NATION'S LEADING ADVOCATE FOR SALTWATER RECREATIONAL ANGLERS. THE CENTER ORGANIZES, FOCUSES, AND ENGAGES RECREATIONAL FISHING STAKEHOLDERS TO SHAPE FEDERAL MARINE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT POLICIES. THE FOUNDATION ALSO ENGAGED AN ADVOCACY FIRM TO DEVELOP RELATIONSHIPS WITH STAKEHOLDERS, ADVOCATE FOR STATE APPROPRIATIONS, AND ADVANCE THE FOUNDATION'S EDUCATION INITIATIVES.
THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO SUPPORT THE FOUNDATION'S EDUCATION AND SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAMS.

GUY HARVEY OCEAN FOUNDATION, INC. HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986. INCOME EARNED IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES. HOWEVER, INCOME FROM CERTAIN ACTIVITIES NOT DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE FOUNDATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE IS SUBJECT TO TAXATION AS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. GUY HARVEY OCEAN FOUNDATION, INC. IS TREATED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, AND NOT AS A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. GUY HARVEY OCEAN FOUNDATION, INC. HAS ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF ASC TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES, AND DOES NOT BELIEVE IT HAS ANY MATERIAL INCOME TAX EXPOSURE RELATING TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE FOUNDATION'S INCOME TAX FILINGS FOR PERIODS AFTER THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2018 REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES NET WITH REVENUE ON FORM 990 89,555.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES NET WITH REVENUE ON FORM 990 89,555.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, GENERAL INFORMATION ON ACTIVITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION PARTNERS WITH LEADING ORGANIZATIONS TO CONDUCT CUTTING-EDGE SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AIMED AT BETTER UNDERSTANDING THE MARINE ENVIRONMENT AND PROVIDING THE INFORMATION NECESSARY TO HELP ENSURE PROPER FISHERIES MANAGEMENT. THE FOUNDATION'S EDUCATIONAL AND SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH PROGRAMS CONDUCTED IN FOREIGN REGIONS INCLUDE SATELLITE TAGGING, DOLPHINFISH RESEARCH, SHARK GENOME RESEARCH, GRAND CAYMAN STINGRAY SURVEYS, EASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC SEASCAPE, AND CORAL REEF RESTORATION. SEE FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4A.

THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS ONE STUDENT THROUGH THE OCEAN EXCHANGE COLLEGIATE AWARD. OCEAN EXCHANGE ACCELERATES THE ADOPTION OF INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS FOR HEALTHY OCEANS AND THE SUSTAINABLE BLUE ECONOMY. THE AWARD IS GIVEN TO THE SOLUTION THAT ADVANCES OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE OCEAN HELPING TO MINIMIZE OUR IMPACT ON THESE RESOURCES WHILE USING THEM FOR HUMAN BENEFIT. ULTIMATELY THIS WILL RESULT IN MORE RESILIENT BODIES OF WATER INCLUDING HEALTHY MARINE LIFE AND COASTLINES. OCEAN EXCHANGE SELECTS THE RECIPIENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH AWARD GUIDELINES. THE FOUNDATION WORKS DIRECTLY WITH WILDLIFE FOREVER IN AWARDING THE GUY HARVEY SHARK AWARD. THE GUY HARVEY AWARD WORKS TO EDUCATE PEOPLE ABOUT ISSUES FACING MARINE LIFE AND HIGHLIGHTS THE WORK DONE BY THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION TO ENSURE THAT FUTURE GENERATIONS CAN ENJOY AND BENEFIT FROM A NATURALLY BALANCED OCEAN ECOSYSTEM. APPLICANTS SUBMIT ARTWORK INCLUDING A SALT-WATER OR ANADROMOUS STATE-FISH SPECIES ALONG WITH AN ESSAY ABOUT THE STATE-FISH SPECIES AND ITS ROLE IN A HEALTHY OCEAN ECOSYSTEM. THE GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION ALONG WITH A MIX OF PARTNERS FROM THE FISHING AND CONSERVATION INDUSTRIES ASSIST WITH JUDGING. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE COORDINATED AND MONITORED BY THE FLORIDA SEA GRANT PROGRAM OFFERED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY OF FLORIDA. THE SEA GRANT PROGRAM CHOOSES THE RECIPIENTS AND TRACKS THE PROGRESS OF THE RECIPIENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH SCHOLARSHIP GUIDELINES.

THE CEO IS ELIGIBLE FOR A BONUS BASED ON NEW-FOUND FUNDING PERFORMANCE MILESTONES. UPON RAISING AN INITIAL NEW-FOUND FUNDING PERFORMANCE MILESTONE OF $500,000 FOR THE FOUNDATION, THE CEO SHALL BE PAID AN INITIAL BONUS BASED ON 10% OF BASE SALARY AT THAT TIME. PRE-EXISTING FUNDING IS EXEMPT AND NOT INCLUDED AS PART OF THE NEW-FOUND FUNDING MILESTONE. SUBSEQUENT TO ACHIEVEMENT OF THE INITIAL PERFORMANCE MILESTONE, EACH ADDITIONAL $250,000 RAISED THEREAFTER ALLOWS FOR AN ADDITIONAL BONUS EQUIVALENT TO 5% OF BASE SALARY AT THAT TIME.

PATXI PASTOR, CEO, WAS COMPENSATED AS AN INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR THROUGH HIS COMPANY PATXI, INC. FOR THE MONTHS OF FEBRUARY THROUGH OCTOBER. EFFECTIVE NOVEMBER 2021, THE CEO WAS COMPENSATED AS A PAYROLL EMPLOYEE. THE COMPENSATION REPORTED IN PART II INCLUDES TOTAL COMPENSATION PAID TO THE CEO DURING THE CALENDAR YEAR FOR SERVICES PROVIDED AS BOTH AN INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR AND EMPLOYEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE L, PART II, LOANS TO AND/OR FROM INTERESTED PERSONS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION HOLDS A PROMISSORY NOTE DATED JANUARY 1, 2019, WITH GUY HARVEY, INC. AND DR. GUY HARVEY (AS PERSONAL GUARANTOR). TERMS OF THE LOAN ARE AS FOLLOWS:1. LOAN TYPE - INTEREST ONLY2. PRINCIPAL AMOUNT - $300,0003. TERM - 4 YEARS (48 MONTHS)4. NOMINAL INTEREST RATE - 5% (ABOVE MARKET RATE)THE LOAN WAS PAID OFF SUBSEQUENT TO YEAR END IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS OF THE NOTE.GUY HARVEY FOUNDATION HOLDS A PROMISSORY NOTE DATED JANUARY 1, 2020, WITH GUY HARVEY, INC. AND DR. GUY HARVEY (AS PERSONAL GUARANTOR). TERMS OF THE LOAN ARE AS FOLLOWS:1. LOAN TYPE - INTEREST ONLY2. PRINCIPAL AMOUNT - $250,0003. TERM - 4 YEARS (48 MONTHS)4. NOMINAL INTEREST RATE - 5% (ABOVE MARKET RATE)THE LOAN WAS PAID OFF SUBSEQUENT TO YEAR END IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS OF THE NOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE L, PART IV, BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING INTERESTED PERSONS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART IV, LINE (1), COLUMN (D): ANNUAL LICENSING - THE FOUNDATION ENTERED INTO A SERVICE MARK LICENSE AGREEMENT EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2019, WHICH ALLOWS THE FOUNDATION TO USE THE LICENSED INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY OF GUY HARVEY INC FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROMOTING PUBLIC AWARENESS OF MARINE AND OCEAN WILDLIFE CONSERVATION. THE LICENSED PROPERTY HAS BEEN CREATED, PROMOTED, COMMERCIALIZED, AND USED BY GUY HARVEY INC, IN THE UNITED STATES AND AROUND THE WORLD, IN WAYS THAT ATTACH MATERIAL VALUE TO THE PROPERTY. UNDER THE TERMS OF THE AGREEMENT, ROYALTY FEES OF $300,000 ARE DUE ANNUALLY.
THE FOUNDATION USES A PLATFORM PROVIDED BY AN UNRELATED THIRD PARTY TO STREAMLINE THE SALE OF AUCTION ITEMS AT ITS ANNUAL GALA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS DR. GUY HARVEY AND JESSICA HARVEY HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. BOARD MEMBERS JODI LEWIS AND STEVE LEWIS HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. STEVE LEWIS VACATED THE BOARD DURING 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS REVIEWED IN DETAIL WITH MANAGEMENT PRIOR TO FILING. THE FORM 990 IS THEN MADE AVAILABLE TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE COMMITTEE USES ITS OWN OBSERVATIONS OF THE PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND RELIES ON COMMENTS AND FEEDBACK FROM STAFF IN ORDER TO EVALUATE OVERALL PERFORMANCE. THE COMMITTEE ALSO REVIES COMPARABILITY DATA OF OTHER SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS TO ENSURE THE COMPENSATION IS WITHIN REASONABLE RANGE. THE COMMITTEE THEN MAKES A RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHO THEN APPROVE THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES ARE NOT REQUIRED DISCLOSURES PURSUANT TO INTERNAL REVENUE CODE IRC SEC. 6104. THESE DOCUMENTS ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THIS TIME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART XI, LINE 8, PRIOR PERIOD ADJUSTMENTS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT WAS CONDUCTED FOR THE YEAR ENDING DECEMBER 31, 2021. AS PART OF THE AUDIT, AN ADJUSTMENT WAS MADE TO RECORD GRANTS PAYABLE TO NOVA SOUTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY (NSU) UNDER THE TERMS OF TWO GIFT AGREEMENTS DATED 2014 AND 2018. UNDER THE 2014 AGREEMENT, THE FOUNDATION COMMITTED $6,000,000 TO NSU WITH $4,000,000 DESIGNATED TO SUPPORT THE RESEARCH AND OTHER ACTIVITIES OF THE NSU GUY HARVEY RESEARCH INSTITUTE AT NSU'S OCEANOGRAPHIC CENTER AND $2,000,000 TO ESTABLISH AN ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP FUND TO BE KNOWN AS THE "GUY HARVEY ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP FUND" TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO NSU UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WHO STUDY OR INTEND TO STUDY MARINE SCIENCE. UNDER THE 2018 AGREEMENT, THE FOUNDATION COMMITTED $850,000 TO NSU TO SUPPORT FACULTY AND GRADUATE STUDENT RESEARCH OPPORTUNITIES BEING CONDUCTED IN THE EASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC SEASCAPE BY THE GUY HARVEY RESEARCH INSTITUTE FACULTY IN THE NSU HALMOS COLLEGE OF NATURAL SCIENCES AND OCEANOGRAPHY. RESEARCH WORK FOCUSES ON THE ECOLOGY, MIGRATION PATTERNS, AND GENETICS OF MAJOR GAMEFISHES AND SHARKS IN THE EASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC SEASCAPE.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: RESEARCH AND EDUCATION FOR SUSTAINABLE MARINE ENVIRONMENTS
